page.title: 15THE NELSON INN.1.
page.content: Karen Worrallo. The landlord of the Nelson Inn is Mr. Rawson.The public house is in the area of Creswell green.The building dates back to the 17th century.Down the road from the Nelson Inn there is a cottage called Trafalgar Cottage.When the public house was first opened they thougt Trafalgar Inn would be a good name but then decided that as Lord Nelson had won the Battle of Trafalgar they would call it the Nelson Inn after him. The Inn is mostly built of brick,slates and wood.The original building has been extended to make it much larger than it was. There are three areas which surround the public house with a car park and a beer garden occupying some of the land.
